text: You can try to convert MathML to SVG.
There's mimetex a stand alone program for rendering latex math... it's not a library however

jHepWork http://jwork.org/jhepwork/
 (version 2.7) generates PNG images from LaTex equations using Java/Jython.

Latex equations can be included into Python (Jython) multiline
 comments using "$" or "$$" keywords (as for the standard LaTeX) 
 and then the program renders them into images embeded
 in HTML represenation of Python/Jython source code (CodeView feature)
A versatile program and Python module to allow conversion of LaTeX math equations in to PNG images: http://code.google.com/p/latexmath2png/ (MIT license, relies on dvipng).
I don't know if this meets your requirements, but I knew MoinMoin has had latex extensions for a while so I looked again and found this:
You should be able to take this code and re-use it in your app.
It is C++ based and runs under both Windows and Linux.
Although unfinished, it can render a number MathML elements.
